Compare two numeric vectors

Source: R/near.R
near.Rd

This is a safe way of comparing if two vectors of floating point numbers are (pairwise) equal. This is safer than using ==, because it has a built in tolerance

near(x, y, tol = .Machine$double.eps^0.5)

Arguments

x, y

Numeric vectors to compare
tol

Tolerance of comparison.

Examples

sqrt(2) ^ 2 == 2
#> [1] FALSE
near(sqrt(2) ^ 2, 2)
#> [1] TRUE

Contents

dplyr is a part of the tidyverse, an ecosystem of packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy. Learn more at tidyverse.org.
